basics.name: Garrett Thompson
basics.summary: Support Engineer at Amazon, M.S. and B.S. in Physics

courses: Studied visible and near-infrared spectral properties of hydrocarbons in a cryogenic setting
Performed experiements in a high vacuum and at temperatures as low as 30 Kelvin
Created a Python program to analyze and quantify collected spectra
Identified trends among samples based on temperature and composition
Presented results at the Division of Planetary Science Conference and Flagstaff Astronomy Symposium
Certificate in Scientific Computation and Simulation
Created a website for physics students to eliminate commercial homework software
Utilized Python, JavaScript, HTML, and SQL to build the platform
Presented results at the Provost's Student Research Showcase

work.summary: Helped organize and coordinate the Alexa Communications org with operational excellence efforts.
highlights: Lead the org in Gameday simulations in preparation for large events like Christmas and Prime Day.
Drove operational excellence initiatives across the Alexa Communications organization
Lead the org in weekly operational excellence meetings to drive improvement and best practices
Applied troubleshooting/debugging to root cause customer tickets.
Drove operational excellence initiatives across the Alexa Communications organization
Drove projects and build internal tools to automate and reduce repetitive tasks

awards.title: Royal Vanderberg Scholarship
awards.summary: Physics GPA ≥ 3.0 as a junior or senior
